Posts.Content: Sep 11, 2010 01:15PM NadineEspana2003 wrote: Hello.  I am 29 years old and was diagnosed in May of this year.   Bilateral mastectomy on the 7the of June.  I started my reconstruction right away and chemo on the 22nd of July.   AC/T Dose dense plus Herceptin for a year.  I am haflway through the chemo.  Done with the A and C, so exctited about this because I was nauseated for 8 weeks straight with it.  Starting the Taxol and Herceptin on Wed.  Not quite sure what the expect with that, hoping for the cakewalk they keep telling me.  I will not know about radiation until the chemo is done.  It's a possibility because I did have two nodes positive.  Even though all the testing that was done when I was diagnosed said that there were no nodes positive.    I did not lose my eyebrows or leg hair, lost hair everywhere else though.   Everyone is different on where they lose the hair.  The drugs affect everyone differently.  I am in good spirits through all of this.   It's the only thing that keeps me going.   The pain from the reconstruction hasn't been nearly as awful as other suggest.  At times it's a dull ache.   I have been expanded twice and only minor discomfort.  Again I think attitude is 90% of this.  Good Luck to you!
Posts.Title: triple positive +-7cm tumor anyone else? lago lago
